intro: Dianthera graminifolia, commonly known as the grass-leaved dianthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to South America, particularly Brazil, this species thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
